ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:0.4_0: The second training rule on acknowledgment
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.2_0: At that time monks were eating invited families.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.3_0: the nuns from the group of six were directing people toward the monks from the group of six, saying,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.5_0: The monks from the group of six ate as much as they wanted,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.6_0: but not so the other monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.8_0: “How can the monks from the group of six not restrain the nuns from giving directions?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that you didn’t do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.12_0: “... Foolish men, how can you not do this?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.13_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.14_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.15.1_0: ‘When monks eat at invitations to families, if a nun is there giving directions, saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice here,” then those monks should stop her:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.15.1_1: If that monk doesn’t stop her, then those monks should stop her:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:1.16_0: “I have done a blameworthy and unsuitable thing that is to be acknowledged. I acknowledge it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.1_0: When monks eat at invitations to families:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.2_0: a family: there are four kinds of family: the aristocratic family, the brahmin family, the merchant family, the worker family.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.4_0: eat any of the five staple foods at invitations.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.6_0: she has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.8_0: saying, “Give bean curry here; give rice here,” according to friendship, according to companionship, according to whom one is devoted to, according to being a co-student, according to being a co-pupil—
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.8_1: This is the name of your family.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.12_0: the nun who is giving directions.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.13_0: Those monks should stop her: ‘Stop, Sister, while the monks are eating’:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.14_0: if she is not stopped by even one monk, and a monk then receives food with the intention of eating it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.1.15_0: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.1_0: If she is fully ordained, and he perceives her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.2_0: If she is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.3_0: If she is fully ordained, but he does not perceive her as such, and he does not restrain her from giving directions, he commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.4_0: If she does not wear one side in her robe, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.5_0: If the other person is not fully ordained, but he perceives them as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.6_0: If she is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.2.7_0: If she is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive her as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.2_0: if a nun has someone else give her own food, but she does not give it herself;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.3_0: if a nun gives someone else’s food, but she does not get anyone to give it;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.4_0: if a nun gets someone to give what has not yet been given;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.5_0: if a nun gets someone to give what has been given to them;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.6_0: if a nun gets someone to give equally to all;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.7_0: if a trainee nun is giving directions;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.8_0: if a novice nun is giving directions;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.9_0: if it is anything apart from the five kinds of staple food;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.11_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-pd2:2.3.12_0: The second training rule on acknowledgment is finished.
